sanskrit_verse:
यस्त्वधर्मेण कार्याणि मोहात्कुर्यान्नराधिपः ।
अचिरात्तं दुरात्मानं वशे कुर्वन्ति शत्रवः ॥ ८.१७४॥
transliteration:
yas tv adharmeṇa kāryāṇi mohāt kuryān narādhipaḥ |
acirāt taṃ durātmānaṃ vaśe kurvanti śatravaḥ || 8.174 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a ruler performs actions through adharma due to delusion, his enemies will soon subdue that wicked soul.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is inseparable from dharma; its misuse triggers inevitable consequence
Delusion in leadership disrupts cosmic order and invites external correction
Capacity-based responsibility mandates alignment with Sanatana Dharma for rulers
Restoration logic operates through natural consequence rather than imposed judgment
Consciousness alignment ensures that misaligned power collapses under its own contradiction
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler's action violates dharma AND stems from delusion THEN automatic loss of influence capacity
IF governing entity acts without dharmic foundation THEN adversarial forces gain lawful ascendancy
WHEN authority diverges from Sanatana Dharma THEN structural collapse initiates by natural law
IF leader demonstrates persistent ignorance of dharma THEN replacement protocols activate automatically
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, when executive or judicial authorities act contrary to Sanatana Dharma due to delusion or willful neglect, their legitimacy becomes subject to dissolution by opposing constitutional forces. The court must recognize such breakdown as lawful consequence, not error requiring punishment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that unrighteous conduct by rulers originates in delusion, which constitutes faulty cognition. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as adversaries assuming control naturally, without punitive intent. Responsibility lies in restoring cognitive clarity, not inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate consciousness recalibration programs for errant leaders
Establish dharmic advisory councils to guide realigned decision-making
Activate community oversight mechanisms to prevent future divergence
Implement knowledge-renewal systems ensuring continuous alignment with Sanatana Dharma
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Justice executed through restoration, not retribution. Reality affirmed as non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
